Job Description:
1)	Business Growth & Reputation
•	Child Protection is seen as the driver in all business activities.
•	All aspects of the school operate in a safe and orderly manner.

•	Ensure that that the business operations of the school fit within the operations of a school.
•	Ensure the proper implementation of all NAE AND Cambodian Health & Safety Laws.
•	Undertake other duties consistent with the scope of the post and within the competence of the post holder as required.

•	Negotiate, as part of a multi-disciplined team, arrangements for new contracts for the schools finding economies of scale where possible
•	Oversee insurance compliance is sufficient and correct policies are in place and managed.
•	Manage the school facilities management and procurement teams.
•	Oversee resources ordering/delivery.
•	Develop and regularly review project capex budgets with project manager.

•	Liaise with corporate customers.
•	Submit capital expenditure proposals to Principal and then to ROD when approved by Principal.
•	Ensure the operation functions support the school’s improvement plans and long-term strategic goals.
•	Drive forward cost saving initiatives to support keeping operational costs within reason and to ensure the best market value for all contracts.
•	Liaise and provide information, as required, to the Regional Operations Director, Regional Office, and central functions.
•	Lead the health and safety committee.
•	Support the work of the Principal and each of the Heads of schools;
•	Fulfil any reasonable additional responsibilities as may be from time to time requested by the Principal and/or Regional Operations Director
•	Overall responsibility for the daily operations function of the school
•	Undertake other duties consistent with the scope of the post and within the competence of the post holder as required.

3)	Facilities
•	Ensure that there are policies in place to frame all aspects of development within the key areas.
•	Manage the facilities maintenance planning with the Finance Manager and Principal.
•	The school is clean, safe, and welcoming.
•	Project management of school expansion projects
•	Regular review of capacity of site and rooms
•	Oversee the security of the school.
•	Partner providers ensure the delivery of appropriate services at a competitive price.
•	Running daily checks i.e. health and safety, maintenance and security;
•	Liaising with maintenance group to ensure the campus is maintained at a high standard.
•	Keeping up to date and accurate records of maintenance and order requests.
•	Ensure the smooth running of the campus office area in terms of monitoring services and specific assigned jobs are being executed efficiently and effectively by the admin and support staff.
•	Oversee and be responsible for the organization of support staffs (cleaners, guards, maintenance staffs) for any school and public performances at campus;

4)	Procurement & Resource Management
•	Procurement operations support the needs of school staff and deliver value for money and in accordance with Procurement Policy.
•	Ensure that a purchase order process is implemented and adhered to by staff.
•	Understand the needs of the school in relation to core areas of procurement, facilities, and operations.
•	Manage all commercial contracts with Partner Provider companies.
•	Coordinate with Bus Service Company, Catering Company to ensure a smooth operation of school services.
•	Liaise with HR Department regarding H&S training for 3rd parties.

5)	Developing Talent
•	Ensure team members have appropriate summaries of their job functions.
•	Manage effective personal development as part of the company’s commitment to quality, staff training and development – this involves active commitment to and participation in the appraisal process, during which individual employee developmental needs will be highlighted.
•	The team develops to support the needs of the growing school.
•	Partner providers understand the changing needs of the school and its community

•	Understanding of the needs of a school
•	Experience of leading complex multi skilled teams
•	Relevant Professional Qualifications
•	Experience of working in a school environment
•	High levels of personal integrity
•	Conscientious and able to focus on completing work to a consistently high standard.
•	Flexible and positive approach to work
•	Excellent organizational and time-management skills; high attention to detail
•	Ability to work to tight deadlines and able to prompt others to ensure deadlines are achieved.
•	Adaptable to working in a fast paced ever changing environment.

•	Self-motivated and enthusiastic
•	Must be a team player, willing to help and be flexible.
•	Continually strive for improvement

Job Description:
** Background and Scope of Position:
The Senior Technical Lead - Nutrition will function as the key person responsible for the management, supervision, and quality assurance for nutrition-related programming for the USAID-funded IECD project 2020-2025. This project focuses on promoting nurturing care for the most vulnerable newborns and young children, starting before birth, using evidence-based integrated programming in early-childhood development to provide for children’s health, nutrition, safety, and security, responsive caregiving for social and emotional well-being, and opportunities for early learning. 

The Nutrition Lead will provide high-quality management support and technical guidance on key activities related to nutrition, agriculture, and WASH, in alignment with other program activities. This position will also be responsible for leading coordination efforts with government counterparts and key stakeholders, especially at the province level, in collaboration with the IECD Chief of Party. The successful candidate will have a strong public health background and be able to provide quality technical expertise across the full scope of the proposed program. 

The Senior Technical Lead - Nutrition will report to the IECD Chief of Party, with alternate reporting responsibility to the Helen Keller Senior Program Manager.
Specific Responsibilities:
•	Ensure effective project implementation for program activities related to health, nutrition, agriculture, gender support, and market linkages.
•	Provide leadership and management for project staff, ensuring integration and coordination across other project technical areas. 
•	Directly manage a team of health, nutrition, gender, and agriculture coordinator; facilitate recruitment, ensure continued, high-quality performance management, and identify staff support needs. 
•	Provide up-to-date, evidence-based technical nutritional guidance and support to the Management Team in the country as it pertains to the focus of this program.
•	Provide technical guidance to the development of annual workplans, in line with the project strategies, to ensure nutrition is integrated with ECD, nutrition and disability activities and that they are operating at scale in all target provinces.
•	Ensure the technical quality of livelihoods and nutrition-related program interventions in all target districts, coaching and building the technical capacity of the field teams to implement the project activities effectively and efficiently.
•	Develop, revise, and adapt nutrition-related materials, curricula, and training; ensure the technical strategies and operations manuals for each of the technical areas are up to date and accurate.
•	Coordinate with government counterparts and represent the project at national and provincial levels; provide technical input into food security and nutrition strategies, programs, and policies as needed, to ensure sustainability and an enabling environment for integrated programming approaches. 
•	Represent the project in national and provincial food security and nutrition technical coordination structures and working groups.
•	Identify, and/or research opportunities for capacity building for local partners (government and NGOs) and contribute to the development of the project’s strategic plan, annual work plans, and country plans and ensure that project documents and reports incorporate the latest technical approaches and interventions. 
•	Provide technical input on the program’s baseline survey, formative assessments, midterm performance review, and end-line survey as well as other identified research and studies.
•	Contribute to the production of quality donor and other reports in a timely fashion – in close coordination with the project team. 
•	In coordination with technical leads and partners, ensure efficient planning and implementation of quality integrated nutrition program activities including selection of appropriate short-term technical assistance and identification and support to operations research opportunities.
•	Promote program learning through direct training and sharing of technical information among the staff so that state-of-the-art approaches are applied consistently across all project interventions.
•	Represent project activities through participation in and/or organization of conferences, workshops, and seminars, and through a range of technical reports, briefs, publications, and presentations.
•	Keep the senior program management team informed about all key issues on a timely basis.
•	Provide technical leadership and oversight of the design, implementation, analysis, and use of the monitoring and evaluation system.
Job Requirement:
•	At least a master’s degree in nutrition, Public Health, Agriculture, or similar field plus at least 9 years of national and/or international experience in nutrition and/or nutrition-sensitive programming, working on programs of similar scope and complexity or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
•	Demonstrated expertise in nutrition required; additional experience in relevant technical areas such as public health, gender, IECD, water/sanitation/hygiene, agriculture, livelihoods, or behavior change communications strongly preferred.
•	Strong understanding of nutrition coordination structures and stakeholders in Cambodia. 
•	Demonstrated ability to manage large, complex teams and programs, including the ability to supervise, coach, and mentor staff to achieve high performance and a cohesive team spirit.
•	Demonstrated success in delivering technical assistance, and in working in collaboration with host country governments and partner organizations.
